result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillion R Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Joint and several with Antoniak 15CF732 and Vaggalis 15CF734 in amounts of:  $245.00 to Speedway; and $185.38 to McDonald's.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment, full time school, or combination of both.
Obtain an AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision conditions  apply to all counts.

Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the  Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and body armor, and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit of 49 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count four. Credit of 49 days.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count five.  Credit of 49 days.
____________________
Defendant is eligible for  Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after 18 months.  The defendant can be released after 30 days if successful.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to BLACK RIVER CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN: AMENDED JOC W6898 EAST STAFFON ROAD BLACK RIVER FALLS WI 54615

Filed and Distributed;  Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18, Judge Colon.  jm

from Dawn Tadych, received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Dillion R Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court indicated counts #3 and #4 were incorrect and erroneously plead to, therefore the Defendant withdrew his plea as to count #3; the Court vacated same.  Pursuant to negoiations, the State ordered Count #3 dismissed and read-in.  As to count #4,   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Dillion R Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 5, & 6:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #s 2, 4, 7, amd 8 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Case adjourned to 08-20-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defendant Dillion R Johnson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dillion R Johnson in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  AS TO COUNT 3:  On motion of the DEFENSE, Court ordered charge amended to, ROBBERY (THREAT OF FORCE)-PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s), 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05 a Class E FELONY.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
